  • @Controller
 @PreAuthorize(value="isAuthenticated()")
class CatalogController
extends java.lang.Object
    A Spring MVC controller to manage the Catalog.

    • Method Detail

      • searchEntryByName

        @RequestMapping(value="/productsearch")
public java.lang.String searchEntryByName(org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                                                                   java.util.Optional<org.salespointframework.useraccount.UserAccount> userAccount,
                                                                                   @RequestParam(value="q",required=false)
                                                                                   java.lang.String searchTerm,
                                                                                   @RequestParam(value="sort",required=false)
                                                                                   java.lang.String sorting,
                                                                                   @RequestParam(value="cat",required=false)
                                                                                   java.lang.String category)
        Shows the search page with all Products which contain the search term (q) in their name, or if search term is not set, shows all Products belonging to the chosen category (cat). The list of results is sorted by the given sorting method (sort).

      • search

        private java.util.Set<GSProduct> search(java.lang.String searchTerm)
        Searches the Catalog for GSProducts which contain the given searchTerm, are in a SubCategory which contains the given searchTerm or are in a SuperCategory which contains the given searchTerm. Returns a Set with the GSProducts matching the Criteria.

      • sortProductByName

        private java.util.List<GSProduct> sortProductByName(java.lang.Iterable<GSProduct> foundProducts)
        Sorts a List of GSProducts by Name. Returns a sorted Set of GSProducts.

        private java.util.List<GSProduct> sortProductByProductNumber(java.lang.Iterable<GSProduct> foundProducts)
